title: Program crashes when trying to catch exception
body:
You have put another call to to nextInt() within the catch block. At that point it is getting a mismatch..hence the crash.

public static Set<Integer> getTicket()
{
    int userInput;
TreeSet<Integer> getNumbers = new TreeSet<Integer>();
Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
System.out.println("Enter your 6 numbers between 1-40: ");
for (int i = 0; i<6 ; i++)
{
    try
    {
        System.out.print(i+1 + ": ");
        userInput = input.nextInt();
         getNumbers.add(userInput);// Place this inside the try block so that only if it is a valid input, it will be added to list.
    }
    catch (InputMismatchException e)
    {
        System.out.println("Invalid");  
        i--; //Decrement so that the invalid input is not counted, and that a valid output can be checked for in its place the next time
       // userInput = input.nextInt(); //Uneccessary line of code
    }

    }
System.out.println("Your ticket was: " + getNumbers);
return getNumbers;
}

As you need to read the input six times, there is no need to call that method again within the catch block. The next iteration of the loop will take care of it.
